questions.question: Add the following vectors graphically: $M = 30\,\text{N}$ east, $N = 20\,\text{N}$ south, $P = 10\,\text{N}$ east. What is the resultant?
questions.explanation: East components sum to $40\,\text{N}$, south $20\,\text{N}$. Magnitude $= \sqrt{40^2+20^2}=44.7\,\text{N}$, direction $= \tan^{-1}(20/40)=26.6^\circ$ south of east.

questions.question: Add the following vectors graphically: $R = 70\,\text{N}$ north, $S = 40\,\text{N}$ south, $T = 40\,\text{N}$ east. What is the resultant?
questions.explanation: Net north $= 30\,\text{N}$, east $= 40\,\text{N}$. Magnitude $= 50\,\text{N}$, direction $= \tan^{-1}(30/40)=36.9^\circ$ north of east.

questions.question: Add the following vectors graphically: $A = 15\,\text{N}$ west, $B = 25\,\text{N}$ north, $C = 20\,\text{N}$ east. What is the resultant?
questions.explanation: Net east $= 5\,\text{N}$, north $= 25\,\text{N}$. Magnitude $= \sqrt{5^2+25^2}=25.5\,\text{N}$, direction $= \tan^{-1}(25/5)=78.7^\circ$ north of east.

questions.question: Add the following vectors graphically: $X = 50\,\text{N}$ south, $Y = 30\,\text{N}$ east, $Z = 40\,\text{N}$ north. What is the resultant?
questions.explanation: Net south $= 10\,\text{N}$, east $= 30\,\text{N}$. Magnitude $= \sqrt{30^2+10^2}=31.6\,\text{N}$, direction $= \tan^{-1}(10/30)=18.4^\circ$ south of east.

questions.question: Add the following vectors graphically: $F_1 = 10\,\text{N}$ at $0^\circ$ (east), $F_2 = 20\,\text{N}$ at $90^\circ$ (north), $F_3 = 15\,\text{N}$ at $180^\circ$ (west). What is the resultant?
questions.explanation: Net west $= 5\,\text{N}$, north $= 20\,\text{N}$. Magnitude $= \sqrt{5^2+20^2}=20.6\,\text{N}$, direction $= \tan^{-1}(20/5)=75.9^\circ$ north of west.

questions.question: Add the following vectors graphically: $U = 35\,\text{N}$ at $45^\circ$ north of east, $V = 25\,\text{N}$ at $90^\circ$ north, $W = 30\,\text{N}$ west. What is the resultant?
questions.explanation: Components: $U$ gives $24.75\,\text{N}$ east, $24.75\,\text{N}$ north; $V$ adds $25\,\text{N}$ north; $W$ gives $30\,\text{N}$ west. Net west $= 5.25\,\text{N}$, net north $= 49.75\,\text{N}$. Magnitude $\approx 50.0\,\text{N}$, direction $\approx 84.0^\circ$ north of west.

questions.question: Add the following vectors graphically: $P = 60\,\text{N}$ east, $Q = 50\,\text{N}$ south, $R = 40\,\text{N}$ west. What is the resultant?
questions.explanation: Net east $= 20\,\text{N}$, south $= 50\,\text{N}$. Magnitude $= \sqrt{20^2+50^2}=53.9\,\text{N}$, direction $= \tan^{-1}(50/20)=68.2^\circ$ south of east.

questions.question: Add the following vectors graphically: $A = 20\,\text{N}$ north, $B = 30\,\text{N}$ east, $C = 25\,\text{N}$ south. What is the resultant?
questions.explanation: Net south $= 5\,\text{N}$, east $= 30\,\text{N}$. Magnitude $= \sqrt{30^2+5^2}=30.4\,\text{N}$, direction $= \tan^{-1}(5/30)=9.5^\circ$ south of east.

questions.question: Add the following vectors graphically: $M = 40\,\text{N}$ west, $N = 30\,\text{N}$ south, $O = 50\,\text{N}$ north. What is the resultant?
questions.explanation: Net north $= 20\,\text{N}$, west $= 40\,\text{N}$. Magnitude $= \sqrt{40^2+20^2}=44.7\,\text{N}$, direction $= \tan^{-1}(20/40)=26.6^\circ$ north of west.

questions.question: Add the following vectors graphically: $F_1 = 15\,\text{N}$ east, $F_2 = 25\,\text{N}$ south, $F_3 = 20\,\text{N}$ north-east at $45^\circ$. What is the resultant?
questions.explanation: $F_3$ components: east $14.14\,\text{N}$, north $14.14\,\text{N}$. Net east $= 29.14\,\text{N}$, net south $= 10.86\,\text{N}$. Magnitude $= \sqrt{29.14^2+10.86^2}=31.1\,\text{N}$, direction $= \tan^{-1}(10.86/29.14)=20.4^\circ$ south of east.

scoreMessages.70: Good work! Practice resolving vectors into components.
scoreMessages.50: Keep practicing. Focus on combining perpendicular vectors.
scoreMessages.0: Review the head-to-tail method and Pythagorean theorem.
